oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews Trisha Yearwood [Pilot Episode]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Trisha Yearwood (performer) for the Ralph Emery Show. Recording is from January 21, 1994.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Trisha Yearwood
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Unidentified Introduction tune [featuring Ralph Emery voiceover] -- (00:20) Emery introduces Trisha Yearwood who discusses the joy to hear people singing "She's in Love With the Boy" -- (00:48) She's in Love With the Boy (Trisha Yearwood) -- (04:31) Walmart commercial break hosted by a pair of unknown voices -- (05:32) Emery invites Yearwood to reflect on "Remembers When" -- (06:49) Remembers When (Trisha Yearwood) -- (10:20) Emery inquires about the influence Don Henley had on Yearwood's career -- (11:38) Emery asks about Yearwood's contribution to the Eagles' tribute album -- (12:28) New Kid in Town (Trisha Yearwood) -- (17:06) Walmart commercial break hosted by a pair of unknown voices -- (18:08) Yearwood reflects on Garth Brooks' rendition of "Like We Never Had a Broken Heart" -- (18:37) Like We Never Had a Broken Heart (Trisha Yearwood) -- (22:09) Walmart commercial break hosted by a pair of unknown voices -- (23:11) Emery and Yearwood discuss the autobiographical nature of "Wrong Side of Memphis" -- (24:05) Wrong Side of Memphis (Trisha Yearwood) -- (26:34) Emery inquires what Yearwood would have done if not for music -- (27:42) Emery performs commercial break, and Emery says goodbye to Yearwood -- (27:56) Unidentified outro tune
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Yearwood, Trisha;
